title: Used to / Be used to / Get used to
title_ru: Used to / Be used to / Get used to

discover.instruction: Read about moving to a new country. Notice the different structures with 'used to'.
discover.instruction_ru: Прочитай о переезде в новую страну. Обрати внимание на разные конструкции с 'used to'.

content.text: When I moved to Japan, everything was different. I <highlight>used to live</highlight> in a warm country, so the cold winters were hard. At first, I <highlight>wasn't used to eating</highlight> raw fish, but now I love sushi! I <highlight>gradually got used to</highlight> taking off my shoes indoors. I <highlight>used to think</highlight> Japanese was impossible, but I <highlight>'m now used to</highlight> hearing it every day. I <highlight>still haven't gotten used to</highlight> the crowded trains, though! I <highlight>used to drive</highlight> everywhere, but I <highlight>'m getting used to</highlight> cycling. Life here is different from what I <highlight>used to know</highlight>.
content.question: What's the difference between 'used to + verb', 'be used to + -ing', and 'get used to + -ing'?
content.question_ru: В чём разница между 'used to + глагол', 'be used to + -ing' и 'get used to + -ing'?

points.rule: used to + infinitive = past habit/state that is NO LONGER true
points.rule_ru: used to + инфинитив = прошлая привычка/состояние, которое БОЛЬШЕ неверно
points.example: I used to smoke. (I don't smoke anymore)

points.rule: be used to + noun/-ing = be accustomed to, familiar with (present)
points.rule_ru: be used to + сущ./-ing = быть привычным к чему-то (настоящее)
points.example: I'm used to the noise. I'm used to working late.

points.rule: get used to + noun/-ing = become accustomed to (process)
points.rule_ru: get used to + сущ./-ing = привыкать к чему-то (процесс)
points.example: I'm getting used to my new job. (becoming familiar)

points.rule: be/get used to can be used in any tense
points.rule_ru: be/get used to может использоваться в любом времени
points.example: I was used to it. I'll get used to it. I've gotten used to it.

points.rule: Common error: Don't confuse 'used to do' with 'be used to doing'
points.rule_ru: Частая ошибка: Не путай 'used to do' с 'be used to doing'
points.example: I used to work late ≠ I'm used to working late

comparison_table.example: I used to live in Paris.

notice.instruction: Identify which structure is used and what it means in each case.
notice.instruction_ru: Определи, какая конструкция используется и что она означает в каждом случае.

tasks.text:
An expat talking about life changes:

1. I used to work in an office, but now I work from home.
2. I wasn't used to video calls at first.
3. Gradually, I got used to virtual meetings.
4. I used to commute two hours daily.
5. Now I'm used to having more free time.
6. It took months to get used to the isolation.
7. I used to eat lunch with colleagues.
8. I've gotten used to cooking for myself.
9. I'm still not used to the silence.
10. But I'm getting used to this new lifestyle.

notice.reflection_question: What form follows 'be/get used to'? What follows 'used to'?
notice.reflection_question_ru: Какая форма идёт после 'be/get used to'? Какая после 'used to'?

questions.sentence: I ___ smoke, but I quit five years ago.
questions.explanation: Past habit no longer true = used to + infinitive

questions.sentence: She ___ waking up early now. It's not a problem anymore.
It took me months to ___ the new software.
questions.explanation: Process of becoming accustomed = get used to

questions.sentence: When I was a child, I ___ play in the park every day.
questions.explanation: Past repeated action = used to + infinitive

exercises.instruction: Complete with the correct form of 'used to'.

sentences.sentence: I ___ (used to/be used to) live in the city, but now I live in the countryside.
She ___ (not/be used to) the hot weather yet.
We ___ (gradually/get used to) our new neighbors.
He ___ (used to) work nights, so he's tired during the day now.
It took years to ___ (get used to) the culture.
I ___ (never/be used to) eating spicy food.
sentences.answer: have never been used to / am still not used to

sentences.sentence: As a student, I ___ (used to) stay up late studying.
Don't worry, you'll ___ (get used to) it soon.

sentences.incorrect: I'm used to get up early now.
sentences.correct: I'm used to getting up early now.

sentences.incorrect: She used to living in London.
sentences.correct: She used to live in London.

sentences.incorrect: I didn't used to like coffee.
sentences.correct: I didn't use to like coffee.

produce.instruction: Write about changes in your life and what you've had to get used to.
produce.instruction_ru: Напиши об изменениях в твоей жизни и к чему тебе пришлось привыкнуть.
prompts: Write about moving to a new place
Describe how your daily routine has changed
Write about starting a new job or school
Describe habits you used to have
produce.example: My life has changed a lot in the last few years. I used to live with my parents, but now I live alone. At first, I wasn't used to cooking for myself - I used to eat my mother's cooking every day! It took me months to get used to the silence in my apartment. I used to think I would hate living alone, but now I'm completely used to it. I've also gotten used to managing my own finances, which I never used to do. I'm still not used to doing all the housework though. I used to have so much free time, but now I'm getting used to being busier. Life changes, and we have to adapt!
criteria: Uses 'used to + infinitive' for past habits
Uses 'be used to + -ing/noun' for current familiarity
Uses 'get used to + -ing/noun' for process of adapting
At least 6 examples of these structures

input_flood.description: Read 5 texts with all three 'used to' structures.

texts.title: New Parent
texts.content: Being a new parent is challenging! I used to sleep eight hours a night, but now I'm lucky to get four. I wasn't used to being responsible for another person. It took time to get used to the constant crying. I used to think I understood tiredness, but I was wrong! I'm getting used to functioning on less sleep. I used to have so much free time. Now I'm used to planning everything around the baby. I'll eventually get used to this new life!

texts.title: Retirement
texts.content: Retirement is a big adjustment! I used to wake up at 6 AM for work. Now I'm not used to having so much free time. I used to interact with colleagues daily. It took a while to get used to the quiet. I wasn't used to being at home all day. I'm gradually getting used to my new routine. I used to define myself by my job. Now I'm getting used to discovering new hobbies. I'm finally used to this slower pace of life.

texts.title: Remote Worker
texts.content: Working from home seemed strange at first. I used to commute to the office every day. I wasn't used to being at home in business clothes. It took months to get used to video meetings. I used to separate work and home life easily. Now I'm used to having them mixed. I'm still getting used to the lack of social interaction. I used to chat with colleagues at lunch. But I've gotten used to my new setup. The flexibility is something I'm definitely used to now!

texts.title: Vegetarian Journey
texts.content: Becoming vegetarian was easier than I expected. I used to eat meat every day. At first, I wasn't used to reading all food labels. I gradually got used to cooking differently. I used to think vegetarian food was boring. Now I'm used to exploring new recipes. My family has gotten used to my choices. I'm still getting used to eating out, as options can be limited. I used to miss burgers, but I'm completely used to plant-based alternatives now.

texts.title: City to Country
texts.content: Moving from the city to the countryside was a shock! I used to have shops within walking distance. I wasn't used to the darkness at night - no streetlights! It took time to get used to the silence. I used to hear traffic constantly. Now I'm used to hearing birds instead. I'm getting used to driving everywhere. I used to think I needed the city's energy. But I've gotten used to the peaceful pace. I'm completely used to my new rural life now.
